description: Sven Halek meets privately with Council and free zone leaders, proposing citywide remembrance rituals and suppressing Halden’s failsafe protocol that would reveal individual BCI interventions.

Public remembrance ceremonies begin: murals and vigils honor those disappeared by the BCI. Grieving families and returning 'ghosted' citizens start to reclaim their stories, but individual BCI intervention records remain sealed.

Nightly remembrance parades and open forums proliferate across Stenograd. Survivors of the BCI share personal stories of loss and survival, blurring lines between victim and participant in community discussion.
Sustained public pressure compels former BCI officials and Council loyalists to confront policies of 'ghosting.' Calls grow for accountability and inclusive history.
A citywide assembly, attended by citizens from every district and free zone, ratifies a new civic pact centered on shared memory, justice, and a commitment to never erase any individual again.
